thread.title: Gartner Cuts Global Semiconductor Capital-Spending Outlook
thread.title_full: Gartner Cuts Global Semiconductor Capital-Spending Outlook

author: morningstar.com
title: Gartner Cuts Global Semiconductor Capital-Spending Outlook
text:
By Tess Stynes
Gartner Inc. (IT) again cut its 2015 guidance for global semiconductor-equipment sales, citing sluggish electronics demand.
The data tracker now expects worldwide semiconductor-capital equipment spending will decline 1% to $63.9 billion this year. Gartner also affirmed its expectations for sector sales to drop 3.3% next year as the result of weaker spending for memory products.
The company also noted that since its previous forecast, capital-spending reductions have been announced by major chip makers including Intel Corp. (INTC), as well as outsourcing firms and integrated-device manufacturers.
On Tuesday, Intel reported that its third-quarter profit fell 6.3% on a small revenue decline. The results revealed more pain from the shrinking personal-computer business, though higher chip prices and demand for larger computers helped soften the blow.
Gartner also had lowered its outlook for chip-making gear sales during July, at the time projecting semiconductor-capital equipment spending growth of 2.5% to $66.1 billion for this year, compared with an earlier estimate for an increase of 4.1%.
Write to Tess Stynes at tess.stynes@wsj.com
 14, 2015 11:48 ET (15:48
